name: Soka Sunday Ritualt ft Sando Club
description: Sando Club, Bangalore brings to Soka their mouth watering famous sandos for 1 afternoon. Here's your chance to try their sandos if you've haven't before,  along with some brunch special Soka cocktails.

name: Cake Painting Workshop
description: Join this unique Cake Painting Workshop at Eywa Café. Learn how to turn your cake into a beautiful canvas using edible buttercream paints. Whether you’re a beginner or a baking enthusiast, this hands-on session promises fun, flavour, and artistry, with a cake you can proudly take home

name: Retro Gaming console workshop
description:
👾 Gamers + Makers, this is for you!
What if you could design, solder, and build your own handheld gaming console – and then power it up to play Super Mario, Pokémon, Contra, and other NES classics?

At the DIY Retro Gaming Console Workshop, we’re combining electronics, creativity, and nostalgia into one unforgettable experience.

You will learn:
• Designing & debugging electronic circuits
• PCB fabrication basics
• Soldering & assembling components
• Using tools with hands-on guidance
• Mentorship from passionate makers

🎮 And the best part?
You’ll walk away with a fully functional retro gaming console that runs Nintendo classics!

Limited seats! Secure your spot today

name: Heart Lamp Interactive Workshop | Freedom, Stories, Art & Reflection
description:
Some books stay with you long after you’ve turned the last page. Heart Lamp, the International Booker Prize–winning anthology by Banu Mushtaq, is one of those rare works. It makes you think and it makes you feel—drawing you into the lived experiences of Indian Muslim women, while also inviting you to reflect on your own world.
This October, we’re bringing Heart Lamp off the page and into our lives with an interactive workshop on the idea of freedom at our Indiranagar store. 
But this isn’t your usual book discussion. Instead, we’ll explore three of the anthology’s most powerful stories through music, art, and storytelling. It’s a chance to step away from screens, share perspectives, and spend a Sunday morning in meaningful conversation with fellow readers. No prior prep is needed—just pick up your copy of Heart Lamp at Champaca before the workshop.

name: Chai Time - Japan Style
description:
Not your usual chai break 👀
Here, you whisk your own matcha, sip it slow, and vibe with chewy-soft mochi that’s almost too cute to eat. 🌸
Write your secret wishes on our dreamy Japanese Wishing Tree (manifest + aesthetic ✨) and let the calm, soulful vibes take over.
It’s chai time… but with a Japanese twist. Calm, fun & totally Instagrammable 💚

name: Chai Time - Japan Style
description:
Chai Time – Japan Style 🌿🍵✨
Not your usual chai break 👀
Here, you whisk your own matcha, sip it slow, and vibe with chewy-soft mochi that’s almost too cute to eat. 🌸
Write your secret wishes on our dreamy Japanese Wishing Tree (manifest + aesthetic ✨) and let the calm, soulful vibes take over.
It’s chai time… but with a Japanese twist. Calm, fun & totally Instagrammable 💚

name: Maestro Impro™️ by Improv Lore
description:
Maestro Impro™️ is a beloved world-famous competitive elimination-style improv format that pits twelve brave improvisers against each other. They’ll take on scenes, games, and challenges from the audience to build never-before seen/heard stories.

After each round, the audience gets to vote improvisers out until just one remains to claim all the improv glory and be crowned the Maestro for the month!
Who are Improv Lore?

We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.

name: PowerPoint Roulette by Improv Lore
description:
PowerPoint Roulette is a fast-paced, creative show where improvisers deliver presentations from slides they’ve never seen before. Each performer is faced with slides filled with bizarre graphs, meaningless acronyms, and unexpected themes. With no time to prepare, they must improvise convincing explanations, facts, stories, and insights on the spot.

Serious business pitches, heartfelt eulogies, hard-hitting TED talks, and fanciful conspiracy theories - prepare yourselves for a night ‘official’ fun! The audience gets to join the revelry by asking questions, creating a truly unpredictable night of improvised theatrics.

Who are Improv Lore?

We are a Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, working towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.

name: Hands-On Art: A Tactile Journey Through the MAP Collection
description:
Join Gurjeet Singh for a unique sensory journey through Visible/Invisible: Representations of Women in Art through the MAP Collection.

Designed for people with visual impairment, this tactile workshop invites participants to explore artworks through touch, then channel their experience into creating personal tactile artworks exploring ornamentation and self-expression. All workshop materials, from textile fragments to modeling tools and decorative elements, are included.

Please note: This workshop is specifically designed for people with visual disabilities. Participants are welcome to bring a friend or family member to join them.

location.name: Museum of Art & Photography (MAP), Ashok Nagar
location.address: Museum of Art & Photography (MAP), Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

name: Y2K REWIND
description:
Come Dressed as a Musical Memory from the 2000s! Transform yourself into a moment when music moved you. Channel the iconic imagery of a beloved album cover, embody the colorful energy of a Bollywood dance number, or bring to life that unforgettable childhood jingle that still plays in your head. We want to see how personal musical connections inspire your creative expression.
 
Join us as we unveil Pulse Vol 5: Soundscapes—our latest exploration into how sound, music, and silence weave through our lives and identities. This captivating issue features diverse voices expressing their sonic experiences through short films, poetry, photography, and more.

location.name: Museum of Art and Photography, Ashok Nagar
location.address: Museum of Art and Photography, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

name: The Art Of Flight
description:
In this 90-minute deep dive into arm balances, we’ll move beyond the surface and into the strength, structure, and spirit of the poses that make us feel like we're flying.

We’ll begin by warming up the body with targeted strength and mobility drills to activate the core, wrists, and shoulders. This lays the foundation for safe and sustainable arm balancing.
From there, we’ll explore essential alignment principles that demystify key transitions and make these seemingly impossible shapes, more accessible.
Through clear breakdowns and playful experimentation, you’ll learn how to “take off” with confidence—whether you’re working on Crow, Side Crow, Hustler’s or Peacock pose.
We’ll also cover how to fall safely, so fear doesn’t hold you back, and give space for mindful repetition, skill refinement, and personal breakthroughs.
Expect a blend of technique, mindset coaching, and drills, all aimed at helping you tap into your inner strength and elevate your practice.

Whether you're just starting to hover or need refining in arm balances; this is a safe space for you to practice and learn.

name: NOT-SO-KLASSIC (Veg)
description:
At Klaa, we’re always celebrating the roots but sometimes, we like to bend the rules.
Not So Klassic is our playful new series where we reimagine Goan flavours through a different lens: layered, experimental, and just a little bit cheeky.

Think familiar ingredients doing unfamiliar things, flavours that surprise you, and plates that tell a new kind of story. Each menu is a limited-edition tasting experience paired with thoughtfully chosen wines to match the mood.

This isn’t your typical Goan thali.
It’s Not So Klassic and we hope you’re as excited to taste it as we are to cook it.

name: NOT-SO-KLASSIC (Non-veg)
description:
At Klaa, we’re always celebrating the roots but sometimes, we like to bend the rules.
Not So Klassic is our playful new series where we reimagine Goan flavours through a different lens: layered, experimental, and just a little bit cheeky.

Think familiar ingredients doing unfamiliar things, flavours that surprise you, and plates that tell a new kind of story. Each menu is a limited-edition tasting experience paired with thoughtfully chosen wines to match the mood.

This isn’t your typical Goan thali.
It’s Not So Klassic and we hope you’re as excited to taste it as we are to cook it.

name: Pint of View (Lecture 5): Fly Me To The Moon
description:
Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.

In our fifth lecture, we’re bringing you Jatan Mehta, a space writer, journalist and author of Moon Monday, the world’s only blog & newsletter dedicated to covering lunar exploration by countries worldwide. He also writes Indian Space Progress, a monthly report on our country’s increasingly relevant space capabilities in the global arena.

Jatan will take us on a journey through humankind’s fascination with our closest celestial neighbour, the Moon. At long last, we are returning humans to the moon! China is aiming to land people on our cosmic companion by 2030, and the US wants to beat them. India is preparing to bring lunar samples. But why has it taken so long to get back to our moon? What sets it apart from Mars and the rest of the Solar System? Come, join us to get answers to these key questions at our lecture: Fly Me To The Moon (From Apollo to Chandrayaan: A Dive into the History & Future of Lunar Exploration).

All of this, over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar! 🍻

What to Expect:

• A 60-minute lecture on the history and future of lunar exploration
• 15–20 minutes of interactive Q&A
• One Geist beer on tap or a mocktail included with your ticket
• A lively mixer to share your insights and learnings and take home a new perspective

Event Details:

📅 Sunday, 28th September | 4 PM – 6 PM
📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar
🎫 Limited to 60 attendees only

About the Lecturer

Jatan Mehta is a globally published space writer and journalist. He authors Moon Monday, the world’s only blog & newsletter dedicated to covering lunar exploration by countries worldwide. Jatan also writes Indian Space Progress, a monthly report on our country’s increasingly relevant space capabilities in the global arena. His space blog can be found at https://jatan.space

About Pint of View

Inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand, walking out with a new way of seeing the world.

Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Lasercut Loom Weaving Workshop!
description:
In this hands-on workshop, you’ll explore the intersection of digital fabrication and traditional craft. We’ll begin by customizing and laser cutting a small weaving loom (approx. 100 × 70 mm), with the option to personalize it through custom engraving. 
Once your loom is ready, you’ll learn the fundamentals of weaving—how to set up the warp, weave different patterns, and experiment with textures and colors. By the end, you’ll take home your own custom laser cut loom along with your woven creation, and the skills to continue weaving on your own. You will get to take home looms of 4 different sizes (40x50mm, 60x90mm, 65x45mm, 35x40mm), including the one you customize.
This workshop is perfect for anyone curious about laser cutting, textile art, or simply looking to try something new and tactile. No prior experience with laser cutting or weaving is required!

-Ages 14 and above.
-Please bring your own Laptops (Mac/Windows/Linux is okay)
-Contact 9845620061 for more details.

name: Silent Reading
description: Too busy to read lately? Here’s your pause button. Step away from the rush and gift yourself two quiet hours with a book and a warm cup of coffee. No deadlines, no distractions - just you, the pages, and a little peace. Bring along your own read or pick one from our shelves and let yourself sink into the story you’ve been meaning to get back to.

name: Be a Neighbourhood Naturalist: A neighbourhood walk with some fun activities
description:
You don't need a forest or a park to spot nature's magic, it's all around you! Join us for a short neighbourhood walk and hands- on activities inspired by the book Be a Neighbourhood Naturalist. 

Be a Neighbourhood Naturalist has been created by a team with decades of experience studying the natural world, and working in the field of nature conservation. Packed with creative experiments and stunning illustrations, this book will open your eyes to the magic of the natural world and the amazing living things that share your neighborhood.

name: Boom Bap with Sakré
description:
We’re back with our latest edition of Weekends at General Items ❤️

This time, we’re thrilled to host a never-before-done session with one of Bangalore’s most exciting musicians and producers, Sakré. He’ll take us through his approach to sound design and sampling, and how he brings it all together in a live performance.
Known for blending the nostalgic charm of retro textures with samples from South Indian cinema, Sakré’s music moves fluidly through lo-fi, experimental hip-hop, and ambient soundscapes that feel both rooted and futuristic.

He’ll be performing his upcoming beat tape Bangalore Sonic Archives live for the very first time ever.

Date: Saturday, 27th September 2025
Time: 12:00 PM to 2:00 PM

location.name: General items, Gangadhara Chetty Rd
location.address: General items, Gangadhara Chetty Rd, Bangalore

name: Sisters & Misters Salsa Workshop
description:
Salsa – Beginner Workshop

Always wanted to try Salsa but didn’t know where to start? This workshop is the perfect first step!

Join us for a fun session for beginners - no prior dance experience required.

We’ll guide you through the basics in a relaxed, playful way so you can feel the music, move with confidence, and discover just how fun and easy Salsa really is.

What to Expect:
1. Easy-to-follow salsa steps 
2. Partner rotations so you meet & dance with everyone
3. Interactive games to learn rhythm & movement

Perfect for:
    •    Total beginners (no dance background needed)
    •    Anyone looking to try something new & exciting
    •    People who love music, movement, and good vibes!

Dress code:

1. Wear whatever makes you feel your best and most comfortable - should be easy for you to move around. 
2. ⁠Carry a pair of socks with you - it’ll help with the dancing. You won’t be needing any special footwear for the session.

name: Chess and Cheers
description: Join the Bangalore Chess Club for 'Chess and Cheers,' a relaxed and social chess gathering designed for players of all skill levels. This event offers a unique opportunity to connect with fellow chess enthusiasts in a friendly and welcoming atmosphere. The gathering is scheduled for three hours, during which attendees can enjoy a variety of engaging chess formats. The ticket not only grants you access to the event but also includes a food coupon valued at ₹200, ensuring you can enjoy some refreshments while you play. The game variations are extensive and designed for maximum fun, including Casual Standard Chess played in a knockout format, the cooperative 'Hand & Brain' variant, the chaotic and exciting 'Bughouse,' a 'Simultaneous Exhibition' where you can test your skills against a strong player, and even 'Anti Chess.' Please be aware of the terms and conditions: tickets are non-refundable, and attendees are requested to arrive 15 minutes early for a smooth check-in process. By attending, you consent to photography and media coverage. This event is a perfect weekend activity for anyone looking to enjoy the game of chess in a casual, non-competitive setting, meet new people, and have a great time.

name: Capsul X Friends: Blr Edition
description: Capsul X Friends brings two days of streetwear, culture, and community to Bangalore, with pop-ups from emerging brands, curated food and drink, and live Capsul Sound Sessions. Hosted at Hatworks Boulevard, it’s a festival-style gathering that spotlights style, music, and lifestyle under one roof.

name: Journey Into The World of Teas
description: Embark on an enlightening journey into the sophisticated world of tea, a beverage steeped in centuries of history and cultural significance. This immersive experience, held at the charming Infinitea cafe, is curated and led by Gaurav Saria, a fourth-generation tea master and chef whose family has been intertwined with the tea trade for over a century. His deep-rooted passion and extensive knowledge provide a rare glimpse into the intricate art and science of tea. During this session, participants will explore the diverse flavor profiles of 4-5 distinct teas sourced from around the world, learning to identify the subtle nuances that differentiate each variety. The workshop goes beyond simple tasting; you will engage in a hands-on brewing practice to understand how different techniques can unlock a tea's true character. To elevate the sensory experience, the teas will be expertly paired with complementary bites, demonstrating the harmonious relationship between tea and food. You will leave not only with a heightened appreciation for this ancient beverage but also with detailed tasting notes and tea samples to continue your exploration at home. This is more than just a tasting; it's a cultural immersion and a celebration of the timeless tradition of tea, perfect for both connoisseurs and curious newcomers alike.

name: A Brownie Bake-Along Experience
description: Delve into the rich, decadent history of the brownie, a beloved American dessert that has captured hearts worldwide since its inception. This hands-on workshop, hosted at the renowned Magnolia Bakery, offers a unique opportunity to master the art of brownie making from scratch. Led by Chef Chaminda, a seasoned confectionery expert with over 18 years of experience who was instrumental in launching Magnolia Bakery's outlets in India, this session is designed for bakers of all levels. Participants will learn the secrets to creating a perfectly moist and fudgy eggless brownie loaf, gaining invaluable tips and techniques directly from a professional. The experience is fully interactive, allowing you to get your hands dirty and bake your own batch of delicious brownies to indulge in and take home. In addition to the hands-on instruction, you will receive an exclusive recipe PDF to recreate the magic in your own kitchen. The ticket price is inclusive of all materials, equipment, and taxes, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable baking adventure. Whether you're a novice looking to learn a new skill or a seasoned baker wanting to perfect your technique, this bake-along promises a delightful and educational experience centered around the gooey goodness of freshly baked brownies.

location.name: The Biere Club, Ashok Nagar
location.address: The Biere Club, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

name: BlackBx + Brunch at the Studio
description: BlackBx + Brunch at the Studio We are all about nourishing food and creating spaces for connection! Blackbx is coming to Indiranagar. Join us for the perfect Saturday morning – a Blackbx strength workout followed by a protein‑backed healthy brunch! We'll start with a workout – think strength done to the beat and reps replaced by loops. A fun way to break a sweat and get in a full‑body workout! Following the session we will all sit together and enjoy a healthy power brunch created by the Studio by Copper + Cloves’ chef team. We'll be focusing on packing in protein and flavour with colourful smoothie bowls, sourdough toasties and protein brownie‑bliss balls – plus your choice of iced coffee or gut‑healthy turmeric shots. The post‑class communal brunch is a great way to meet like‑minded people who also love working out on a Saturday morning! This is a beginner‑friendly workout, although any recent or serious injuries should have clearance from your doctor and contact us before booking. What’s included: a 50‑minute strength workout by Angela and Saipreet from BlackBxx; Brunch by Copper + Cloves; Yoga mats. What’s not included: Valet parking is not available – please grab a ride. Where it is: 4th Floor, 167, 2nd Stage, 2nd Cross, Shankarnag Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India.

location.name: The studio by copper and cloves
location.address: The studio by copper and cloves, Bangalore

name: A Hands-on Gardening Workshop
description: At Zuva Life, we believe growth isn’t just about what’s planted in the soil, it’s also about what takes root within us. This gathering is an invitation to step outside, try something new, and reconnect with both nature and community. Together, we’ll explore gardening as more than a skill—it’s a mindful practice that restores balance, sparks joy, and builds resilience. About the Facilitator: Through her venture, Its Thyme to Garden, founded in 2020, Anu has taught the basics of gardening to more than 6,000 people of all age groups, and also consults on kitchen and ornamental gardens. In addition, through her NGO – The Anugraha Project – she has set up a community kitchen garden to serve underprivileged communities. Her dream is for every home to grow its own safe, organic food, while discovering the joy, healing, and health that come from gardening. What You Will Experience • A welcoming space to learn, reflect, and connect with others • Simple, step‑by‑step guidance on planting and caring for your greens • The joy of digging into the soil and finding calm in nature’s rhythm • Fresh insights on how tending to plants mirrors the care we need for ourselves No matter your experience, seasoned gardener or total beginner, this workshop is designed for everyone. Tools and materials are ready for you; all you need is comfortable clothing and an openness to get your hands a little muddy and your spirit refreshed. Come for the plants, stay for the community. You’ll leave with not just gardening skills, but a circle of connection, and your very own grow bag to kickstart your own patch of green at home! cite sources… (urbanaut.app)

name: Motorcycle Coaching Workshop
description: The Foundation Bangalore Motorcycle Coaching Workshop by Enfield Riders is a multi-day practical coaching program designed to build riding skills and confidence. The workshop provides a total of approximately 12 hours of coaching, typically spread across a weekend (two days, six hours per day). The curriculum emphasizes practical riding skills, supervised on-ground drills, and essential safety techniques. The program is comprehensive, with the package including a motorcycle with fuel for practice, experienced coaching staff, and sanitized safety gear such as knee and elbow guards. Upon completion, participants receive a certificate and merchandise. This workshop is aimed at improving rider confidence and technique through hands-on, supervised practice. Multiple batches are run across different local venues in Bangalore, including Koramangala, Jakkur, Whitefield, and Electronic City. Batch 3, which includes the dates September 27th and 28th, falls within the specified event window. Full registration details and program information are available on the official product page.

name: A Bite of Calorie: Walkthrough
description: The Science Gallery Bengaluru team leads a walkthrough of Calorie, their new exhibition exploring food, nutrition, and energy. Moving through the galleries, participants will reflect on the complex relationships between nourishment, health, and the systems that sustain us, unpacking how what we eat shapes both our bodies and our world.

name: ISL Scavenger Hunt
description: Join an inclusive treasure hunt where deaf and hearing participants team up to solve clues and explore the museum together. Our specially designed brochure features QR codes that unlock Indian Sign Language (ISL) videos, making every clue accessible and engaging for all participants. This event is part of the International Week of the Deaf, presented in collaboration with MAP and Hear a Million (HAM). The scavenger hunt is designed to be an engaging and educational experience, promoting inclusivity and a deeper understanding of Indian Sign Language (ISL) within an artistic context. Participants will navigate through the museum’s diverse galleries, solving puzzles and learning about art and culture in a fun, interactive way. The event strongly encourages teamwork and provides a unique opportunity for both deaf and hearing individuals to connect, communicate, and share a memorable experience. All necessary materials and guidance will be provided by the event organizers to ensure a smooth, enjoyable, and enriching experience for everyone involved. This is more than just a game; it's a celebration of communication, art, and community, making the museum accessible and exciting for all.

name: International Peace Day Run
description: International Peace Day Run 2025 Cambridge Layout, Bengaluru 27th September 2025 Running Register Now About the event INTERNATIONAL PEACE DAY RUN 2025 Run for Peace • Run for Unity • Run for a Cause! Date: Sunday 27th September 2025 Time: 5:30 AM – 8:00 AM Venue: Bangalore (Cubbon Road), organized by GAGNER SPORTS Celebrate International Peace Day 2025 with a vibrant high‑energy morning full of purpose, positivity, and fun! Whether you’re a runner or just love being active, there’s something for everyone! Event Categories: 3K Fun Run – ₹700 – Timed – just bring your energy and enthusiasm! 5K Run – ₹900 – includes timing chip – age categories: 49 & below / 50+ – men & women 10K Run – ₹1100 – includes timing chip – age categories: 49 & below / 50+ – men & women Bonus Highlight: ZUMBA SESSIONS! Warm up with energetic Zumba to dance, sweat, and smile your way into the race! All Participants Receive: Exclusive event T‑shirt Finisher medal Timing chip (for 5K & 10K) E‑certificate Refreshments and snacks Ambulance and medical support Nutritious breakfast Top 3 Winners (men & women in timed categories) will be awarded trophies and exciting gift vouchers. Whether you’re running for health, peace, or just a good time, come be part of a morning that moves the body and uplifts the spirit! (indiarunning.com)

location.name: St Aloysius School, Frazer Town
location.address: St Aloysius School, Frazer Town, Bangalore

name: Floral Workshop
description: 🌸 Join us for a hands-on Floral Workshop on September 27th at Café Zubaan, Koramangala 🌿✨Learn, create, and take home your own floral magic!📅 Saturday, Sept 27⏱ 10 AM – 12 PM📍 Café Zubaan, Koramangala👉 Sign up now through the link in our bio!( flowers, workshop, Koramangala, Urth , weekend activities, floral workshop)

name: AnyBody Can Dandiya 5.0 - Palace Grounds
description: Think Dandiya? Think DesiClans. This Navratri, step into a world of color, culture, and celebration — where tradition meets royalty. Welcome to the 5th Anniversary Edition of Anybody Can Dandiya — Bangalore’s Biggest Dandiya at the magnificent King’s Court, Palace Grounds. After four sold‑out editions, DesiClans is back to redefine grandeur with a milestone celebration that fuses timeless tradition with unmatched elegance. Step into a royal indoor setting that promises scale, comfort, and spectacle — a venue worthy of a landmark edition. This is more than an event. It’s a five‑year legacy. It’s the ultimate Navratri experience. It’s The Biggest Indoor Dandiya Bangalore has ever seen. King’s Court, Palace Grounds – Bangalore’s Most Iconic Royal Venue. 27th September & 1st October. A Grand Festival. A Royal Setting. A Cultural Legacy. Don’t miss your chance to be part of the most anticipated indoor dandiya celebration in the city — with all the beats of garba, rhythm of heech, and joy of sanedo under one royal roof. Mark your calendars. Book your tickets. Bring your tribe. Event Highlights: Live Musical Performances: Gujarat’s top folk artists bring authentic garba, heech, and sanedo to life Royal‑Scale Dance Floors: Spacious and luxurious — enough room for everyone to twirl in style Fully Air‑Conditioned Palace Venue: Grandeur and comfort go hand‑in‑hand at King’s Court Complimentary Dandiya Sticks: Enter ready to groove — we’ll handle the rest Professional Dancers: Follow their lead or get inspired to shine on the floor Traditional Fashion Show: Where festive flair meets royal runway Electrifying Dhol Acts: Heart‑thumping beats to ignite the spirit of the night Stylish Photo Booths: Frame your moments in regal settings Maha Aarti: A spiritually uplifting gathering under one majestic roof Live Food Stalls: Watch your favorites prepared fresh, right before your eyes — hot, aromatic, and festive Unlimited Vegetarian Buffet: Savor festive starters, rich mains, warm breads, aromatic rice, cooling sides & royal sweets Top‑Notch Security: Your safety is our priority, with trained security personnel on‑site Special 5‑Year Giveaways – Lucky draws, anniversary awards & surprises you won’t want to miss! Note: For the comfort and tradition of all our guests, non‑vegetarian food and alcohol are strictly prohibited.(in.bookmyshow.com)

name: Drum Jam
description: The Bangalore School of Music presents Drum Jam 2025, a percussion showcase at the Aruna Sunderlal Auditorium. Featuring student performers and community drumming, the event brings together rhythm, energy, and collaboration in a celebration of live music. Free and open to all, it’s an invitation to experience the power of drums in unison.

name: Piyu Bole Semiclassical workshop
description: Good Move Studios hosts a semi-classical dance workshop set to Piyu Bole, blending expressive movement with graceful choreography. Led by Always on Taal, the session offers an afternoon of rhythm, storytelling, and technique in an intimate studio setting.

name: Shuffle Workshop w/ Sana
description: ARSD India hosts a two-day shuffle dance workshop with Sana Nasim, featuring an open-level introduction to shuffling and cutting shapes on Day 1, followed by a choreography-focused session on Day 2. The workshops dive into technique, rhythm, and flow, offering dancers a chance to refine their style and groove in an immersive setting.

name: Desi Breakfast Club
description:
From the deep, masala-laden bite of Bedmi Poori to the indulgent fluff of Chole Bhature, every plate is a page from a desi breakfast diary.

Craving something richer? Keema Pav brings the heat. And the Parathas? Stuffed, griddled, and made exactly the way they should be — with love, ghee, and no shortcuts.

This isn’t a meal. It’s a morning well spent.

Now Serving Desi Breakfast only at Treat.
Every Sunday 09:30 am - 11:30 am

PLEASE NOTE: We have two time slots available for the Desi Breakfast Club:

Slot 1 - 09:30 AM - 10:15 AM
Slot 2 - 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM

- Once you send in your reservation request, our team will get in touch to confirm your preferred timing. If your chosen slot is full, we’ll happily offer you the next available one.

- To reserve your spot, we’re charging a small fee of ₹200 per person—which is fully redeemable against your meal. You’re free to choose anything from the menu, and if your bill goes over, you can simply settle the difference at the restaurant.

Can’t wait to see you at the Desi Breakfast Club ☀️
